intro: Psychotria schliebenii var. parvipaniculata, commonly known as the small-bracted Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent, fleshy calyx. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
